New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a career-defining go-ahead grand slam in the bottom of the sixth inning.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a go-ahead grand slam in the bottom of the sixth inning, sending the Mets to their first NLCS in nine years.
Ranger Suárez worked his way out of early trouble, stranding runners in scoring position in the first two innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Nick Castellanos issued a warning, saying that if the Phillies came back to win, the Mets wouldn't want to go back to Philly for a Game 5.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos reflected on the series and acknowledged the Mets' performance, saying 'Give them their credit—they beat us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets outplayed their division rivals by 10 games over the final four months and won the season series 9-8.
The Mets will face the winner of the Padres-Dodgers series in the NLCS.
Others: The series ended with the Mets taking a 3-1 lead in the NLDS, forcing a Game 5 in Philly, which they won to advance to the NLCS.
